body:
`sh` doesn't support the `${OP_NODE_L2_ENGINE_RPC//ws/http}` variable substitution introduced in #119. Replace with `bash`.

Fixes #122.
As recommended in https://optimism.instatus.com/clncyjz7b171224y9n6bne09fj7

# What

This adds a github action workflow, similar to the on_merge `docker.yml` file that runs on `pull_request` that will build the `Dockerfile` at the root of the gitrepo in order to verify building the dockerfile still works, so that there are not merges that break the docker build.  The build will not push, as there is no login attempt step or creds specified

# Testing

You should see the job complete in the github actions

This PR updates the hdd requirements and also adds snapshot info.

Currently to restore a snapshot for mainnet, it would require approximately 450GB of disk space. This would exceed the current minimum requirement of 100GB mentioned in the README, so I've updated it to ~500GB~ 1TB.

Closes #110 
Closes #109

Added the description how to prune op-geth.
I think  it can prune safely.

https://github.com/base-org/node/issues/107

- SSD requirements 100GB -> 1 TB
- Adding how to download a snapshot

### Description
Update op-node to v1.1.3

Add a dumb-init to support forwards signals to children process to support graceful shutdown in op-geth/op-node

ref => https://github.com/Yelp/dumb-init

Fixes #75

#54 switched to downloading tar.gz files from Github. Unfortunately this strips the .git information from the download, which breaks go-ethereum's `build/ci.go` ability to read commit and tag information.

Upgrading from `v1.101106.0` to `v1.101200.1-rc.2`.

This brings in all of the changes included in [v1.101200.0](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/op-geth/releases/tag/v1.101200.0), as well as a fix for some txpool leaks (see https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/op-geth/pull/122).

https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/op-geth/releases/tag/v1.101200.1-rc.2
Base has a private mempool with gossip disabled. Disabling this for nodes by default makes sense, in case people run shared nodes. Folks can opt-in individually if they need it for a specific reason.

Additng P2P_PORT into geth-entrypoint.
For Docker with host network it could be important.

I'm not sure which version of docker-compose should be used here, I just picked the latest. The reason to add a version is explained in Docker's docs:

> Version 1 is deprecated... Compose files that do not declare a version are considered “version 1”.
https://docs.docker.com/compose/compose-file/compose-versioning/#version-1-deprecated

Fyi: Docker compose v3.8 is "It is only available with Docker Engine version 19.03.0 and higher."
mainet -> mainnet
Adds a badge with a link to the Base Discord in the README; shows number of people currently online.
Same as #62 but for mainnet.

Currently, any attempt at shutting down the container will result in a forced stop due to the app being created as its own process in the entrypoint script. Adding exec will run the app as PID 1 and handle graceful shutdowns.

Any forced shutdowns with geth or similar software usually results in corrupted and lost state that will result in syncing from a much greater timeframe on reboot.
...and add comments to the remainder of the ports

- `docker`'s `--env-file` parsing doesn't like the trailing comments, so move them onto separate lines
 - minor formatting cleanup

- [Move environment config to separate .env file](https://github.com/base-org/node/commit/ea42ce735d03bd0d8841a290ff11cca5022f1579)
 - [Remove volumes config (already in README)](https://github.com/base-org/node/commit/b32cee281f0160b2d359963d9c840b2c27564f27)
 - Minor styling cleanups

Rather than using commit SHAs, switch to released versions:
 - op-node: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/releases/tag/op-node%2Fv1.1.0
 - op-geth: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/op-geth/releases/tag/v1.101105.3

# What

This updates the dockerfile and compose scripts slightly to cleanup some things and follow some best practices around docker

1.  Remove the whole local git repo configuration that is done to build both geth and optimism repos, as it is creates unnecessary complexity.  Instead simply download github public tarballs of the sha references.  Another additional benefit is that this can use `sha256sum` checking on the tarballs.  In order to use `ADD --checksum=sha256:` you must use the docker `# syntax=docker/dockerfile:1-labs` https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/builder/#syntax

1.  Cleanup `/var/lib/apt/lists` as this is unnecessary bloat in the image

1.  Remove the `.sh` from the entrypoint files as they already have interpreters and exectuable files generally do not have extensions.

1.  Removes the `"sh"` command to run the entrypoints in the docker compose file, because of the same reason, the scripts have `bash` interpreters

1.  Only Copy the `geth-entrypoint` and `op-node-entrypoint` scripts and the appropriate `goerli` folder.  The current docker image includes all the other files in this repo due to a `COPY . .`, which is really not necessary

```
$ docker run -it --entrypoint sh mitsuwa/node:latest
# ls
CONTRIBUTING.md  Dockerfile  LICENSE  README.md  SECURITY.md  docker-compose.yml  geth	geth-entrypoint.sh  goerli  logo.webp  op-node	op-node-entrypoint.sh
```

The image reduction is about 20 mb

# Testing

This builds the image via `docker compose up --build` and geth and op clients startup

Currently geth data is stored within the container. This means all chaindata is lost whenever the container is destroyed, for example when upgrading to the latest version using ```docker-compose down``` instead of ```docker-compose stop```. This can be prevented by volume mounting the data directory to a directory on the host machine, which this PR proposes.

Another more "polluted" options is 
```
command -v jq &> /dev/null && echo Latest synced block behind by: \
$((($( date +%s )-\
$( curl -s -d '{"id":0,"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"optimism_syncStatus"}' -H "Content-Type: application/json" http://localhost:7545 |
   jq -r .result.unsafe_l2.timestamp))/60)) minutes || { echo "mvn is not installed" 1>&2 ; }
```

Providing more information in README.md (edited)

This PR adds Issue and PR templates to the repository to help organize the way issues and pull requests are opened, by standardizing the type of information that gets submitted.

I pulled these over from the [Coinbase Wallet SDK](https://github.com/coinbase/coinbase-wallet-sdk/tree/master/.github); they're the same ones that are being used there, except refactored for Base. You can [play with opening an issue over there](https://github.com/coinbase/coinbase-wallet-sdk/issues/new/choose) to get an idea of what it looks like. *Note:* I dropped the smartphone-related info from them before adding to this repo since it's not going to be relevant for the purposes of running a node.

When/if #15 is incorporated I would also follow-on to update this in the future to ask users to include a version when opening an issue. I left this section out for now since there is no versioning at present in the repo.

Providing more information about how Base Nodes work

Similarly to PR #11 , I grabbed this from https://github.com/coinbase/salus/blob/master/SECURITY.md thinking it would be OK to use. This template simply instructs people with reports to submit them via [Coinbase's HackerOne page](https://hackerone.com/coinbase).
I grabbed and copy/pasted this from https://github.com/coinbase/salus/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md, assuming that might already be OK to use (since this repo didn't have it).

Hello, in case welcome I added some nice (hopefully others think so 🤣) badges to the README. They link to various parts of the repository and also back to the Base website, blog, docs and Twitter account. You can play with them using the [README on my fork](https://github.com/wbnns/node/blob/add-badges/README.md).

I've also included screenshots below to demonstrate the change, before and after. Each badge is its own commit in case you all would like to drop some but keep others. Cheers.
